website_summaries.verdict: A powerful stove that works with both propane and butane, although some felt that the quality was a little off.
pros: Dual fuel stove works with both butane and propane (comes with an adapter for the latter)
Produces a good, even flame, and is capable of 15,000 BTU in all
Safety features include a pressure-sensor cartridge ejection system, and a gas-flow cut-off mechanism
cons: Reports of quality issues that include uneven burners, canister covers that don't close, and chipped paint

customer_reviews.title: Good flame adjustment.
customer_reviews.text: Good flame adjustment and gets the job done on high. Pros: Works equally on both butane and propane. Good customer service. Cooking grate was damaged on arrival and Gas One responded immediately with the replacement. Cons: Came with a stiff hose that will not straighten from bends where it was stored inside and caused it to spring back against the stove while cooking which melted the hose. No replacement found on Amazon or elsewhere. Yes I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Inspector Gadget

customer_reviews.title: Original Review 5 ⭐️ but now 1 - Broken regulator valve and no way to contact seller
customer_reviews.text: Love the product but it is now useless. The regulator valve for the propane side busted and blew off. Thankfully it happened when no one was near it. I tried to find a way to contact the seller or Amazon but the time for refund is passed and there is no way to leave a message. This is my only recourse. The valve is plastic and if it had been metal it would probably be okay now. The rest of the burner is quality - why go cheap on the valve? Another buyer had the same issue. Now I am searching for a metal regulator with a fitting that will fit this burner. Any advice is appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Fern

customer_reviews.title: I love this little stove. Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I purchased this for a small utility trailer I’ve made into a tiny camper. I also purchased the butane cylinders although I already had propane cylinders. I mean, it lit just like advertised so smooth it almost frightened me! The next day we had a power outage and I was able to use it for one-pot cooking. I just love this little stove! So glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Karenann

customer_reviews.title: worthless unit
customer_reviews.text: New out of the box does not work, the lever that secures the butane canister does not move enough to secure the canister. Internal workmanship is terrible. Returned the day I received it and ordered a Iwatan 35FW, cost afew dollars more but the 35FW is a beautiful thing, workmanship is above average.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Red cap suddenly leaked using propane
customer_reviews.text: I was using this for a couple of weeks and then I’m not even using it when I suddenly smell propane and then saw it leaking strongly. The red cap leaked and as you can see it is kind of frozen. I did not take a picture of it while leaking because it has been leaking a while and I’m afraid to have an accident.
customer_reviews.author: R. G. Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 1st use
customer_reviews.text: Was working great until it broke. During the very First use! The LOCK popped and doesn't hold the gas canister anymore, no way to lock it, so no way to use the Gas One grill. Goes into the trash. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap broken adapter hose
customer_reviews.text: The stove worked great, but the 1lb propane adapter hose broke on the third use and I can't find a replacement, no contact info available for suipport on GasOne page. One day past return window so stuck with unusable stove!
customer_reviews.author: Insomniac

customer_reviews.title: Sounded great, but very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This product seemed like the perfect solution to a grilling need I have. I purchased the burner, hooked it up and it worked great for about 2 months. then I started to smell propane gas and found a red plastic part on the gas line simply broke for no apparent reason, allowing gas to leak out. Rather dangerous for something to break so fast, especially for no apparent reason!
customer_reviews.author: marissa taylor

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Stove
customer_reviews.text: Nice Little Stove I would have given 5 stars but the butane door is a little loose and rattles. So the best part of this stove is that the actual burner is awesome it has some crazy high turbo type mode its actually makes a sound when turned up high. Definitely the highest quality burner element I have ever seen its brass and has some air input. Its actually better than most of the gas stoves I have used super smooth adjustment and good range of super low to super high. Says 15,000 and I believe it.
customer_reviews.author: AJC

customer_reviews.title: Catastrophic valve failure
customer_reviews.text: First, luv the dual fuel option... BUT after ~6 or so propane 1lb bottles were used there was a catastrophic failure of the red valve on the included adapter hose. It was sitting on the counter not in use at the time, had there been a flame there would have been an explosion that would have caused serious, if not fatal outcome. While I realize the hose is probably outsourced we will no longer utilize the stove in our camp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gas One 3900P Dual Fule Burner
customer_reviews.text: I received my Gas One 3900P a few days ahead schedule,when I opened the package everthing was there,The LP hose had been placed in the area for the Butane Canister and bent the cover some but was easley push back in shape.I received my Butane canisters approximately a week later..I placed one in the butane canister in the holder and it lit on the first try. I would recommend to anyone for camping or when there is a power outaged.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: I shopped specifically for a burner to use with my high carbon steel hand hammered Chinese wok. My electric stove has a maximum of 2000 BTU’s on the large burner plates. (I looked it up online by serial number). The Gas One GS-3900 puts out 15,000 BTU’s in a vortex of blue flame that works perfectly. Heats fast and more cleanly than more rudimentary cast iron burners. I wasn’t sure if 15,000 was going to be enough for my heavy 13” wok. It’s plenty and very controllable. Well thought out design. I like the brass burner head. No rusting. I used it to season my new virgin wok, turning it into a non-stick gunmetal blue. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Trauer

customer_reviews.title: Great option for cooking outside
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Gas One to use primarily for searing steaks, pork chops, etc. outside rather than in my kitchen. I purchased an Anova sous vide during Amazon Prime Day, and love it. After cooking the meats in the sous vide, however, you need to sear the meat either on a grill or in a pan. My grill works, but a good cast iron pan works better. Unfortunately, it tends to smoke up the kitchen. I take my Gas One outside on the patio to do the sear, and it's GREAT! I use the small propane tanks rather than butane, because they're easier to find. And the Gas One heats the pan up like crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: One problem, I have to connect and disconnect the propane adapter hose every time I use the stove. looks like the propane adapter was an afterthought. If I am using the propane adapter hose and want to put the stove back in the carrying case, I have to take the adapter hose out or it will be cut. The simple fix is to make a carrying case with a space for the hose or redesign the stove to resolve the issue. Other than that, the heat output is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: SAH

customer_reviews.title: Still looking for the best portable stove.
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed... when you think gasone you used to think about something of good quality. I have been using the stove everyday for about a week now. So far The only good thing I can say about it is the 15,000 btu I know it will last if I take really good care of it because the rest seems and feels cheap. The knob feels like playing with a toy... the case is a complete joke. Have to say I was expecting more for $60 bucks... Not the greatest not the worst. Just ok. Not a good first impression or second. I really hope it last but we’ll see.
customer_reviews.author: Libido

customer_reviews.title: So far so good - Takes generic butane cans
customer_reviews.text: One of the international reviews gives bad info claiming proprietary butane needed. That's simply incorrect. I put a Coleman brand butane bottle in this unit and it works just fine. The burner worked great for deep frying with a 7qt dutch oven. Came up to temperature quickly, and was able to maintain heat well as I fried different items. Good range of flame intensity as well - I am able to turn the flame down low for a simmer, which many such burners aren't good at.
customer_reviews.author: deeddawg

customer_reviews.title: Nice little stove
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of looking around before I ordered the Gas One. It is a little more expensive than other brands, but a better investment. What I like best about this stove is that it is multi-fuel; butane and propane. It is compact, durable, and has an effective wind blocker. Two downsides; first, the small butane canisters don't last long and second, I wish Gas One had spent a little more money in the design and manufacture of the carrying case which seems flimsy. Otherwise well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tom O

customer_reviews.title: Hot and right NOW!
customer_reviews.text: I considered buying the cheaper version of this little gas portable stove that had fewer BTU's. Boy, am I glad I went for this one (15K vs 7K BTU's). I bought this to use with a cast iron panini pan for searing steak. I use an infrared thermometer to make sure the pan reaches about 450 F for this purpose. So I fired this stove up using the 16 oz propane cylinder. I timed how long from cold to 450 F...it took less than 3 minutes! Wow! Heck, I can't get that kind of fast warm up from my gas range in the house. So I am really impressed with the performance...Hot and right NOW!
customer_reviews.author: Philip W. Knopp

customer_reviews.title: Serious heat output, but able to cook at low temperatures too.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is light weight, compact and pack a serious punch, with respect to heat output. I Full Time RV and do lots of cooking outside my rig with propane. This is the best solution I've found to cook my daily meals. The burner puts out far more heat than my indoor 3 burner Furion stove and is more accurate at low flame settings, which is very important for slow cooking. It even comes with a storage case, which is a nice addition. I would highly recommend this for anyone cooking outdoors, that needs a stove with superior heat output, with the ability to cook at low flame as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fiore

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this brand - they are dangerous!!!  The place where the fuel connects catches fire!!!
customer_reviews.text: We've had 2 of this brand of stove. We had this one for 15 months. We had a fire where the fuel connects to the stove under the lid. The same thing happened to a 2 burner stove of this brand in the exact same place. We were lucky - it could have caused an explosion. If you do buy one, never, ever turn your back on it.
customer_reviews.author: Cowgirl2mk

customer_reviews.title: Great Heat!
customer_reviews.text: This is big improvement on the 9,000 BTU burners and adequate for stir fry using a 12" round bottom wok and wok ring. I would modify the ring to lower the wok closer to the burner but I cut 1/2" off each of the four grate tynes to open up the area wide enough that the wok rests on the grate with a ring. It is advertised for indoor use but the box and manual say outdoor use only. If using 16oz. propane bottle indoors always crack a window and run the range hood vent then disconnect the propane bottle and put it away immediately afterward. Common sense.
customer_reviews.author: skelly

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: Had super high hopes for this burner but the 3rd time we used it there was a loud pop and it quit working.
customer_reviews.author: Phil B

customer_reviews.title: OK product, but should have gotten the one at half the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for most of a year and have been relatively satisfied. However one of the prongs of the four prongs that support your pan has worked loose at where it was welded on. And now the regulator on the propane adapter (red plastic) has started letting out a lot of gas. Hope I can find a way to repair the regulator instead of shelling out $12 to replace the adapter on a $60 stove. That's 20%! And the reviews for the replacement adapter says this leak is a common failure.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little stove, super convenient as it uses propane& butane :-)
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome, powerful little stove. Because it works with either butane or propane, I never run out of fuel. It self-starts and makes a pot of coffee really quick:-) an important thing on a cold morning, after just waking up and starting your camp breakfast. It's expensive, and I do believe the cost can and should be brought down. That said, this is now my go-to stove for camping. I used to use my trusted dual burner Coleman stove, but as soon as you start up burner number two, it decreases the BTU dramatically. I'm better off having two or three of these little stoves and getting my cooking done quicker and easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmymac

customer_reviews.title: Great burner but be careful
customer_reviews.text: The burner works great, but the butane tanks are expensive so I used the converter hoses to connect to a 20lb propane tank. The adapter hose that comes with the unit began leaking and filled my covered porch with propane. Fortunately it did not cause a serious problem. Now I'm having trouble finding a replacement part for it so its back the very expensive butane tanks...
customer_reviews.author: Martha L Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, a little expensive but it is great
customer_reviews.text: Can only speak on initial performance, it is very good at starting, always ignites on the first try and the flame heat stays strong with the metal guards around the perimeter. Is it really 2x stronger than the old butane grills? I can't say but it is definitely bigger and stronger. Then again, this is priced 2x more than the old generic butane grills so its your call. I went by my local H-Mart/Lotte and they have cheap ones for $19.99-$24.99 but they are not 15,000 BTU butt 7,500. I enjoyed the last two times I used this on my deck. lasts about 2 hours per can.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Drake Ramoray

customer_reviews.title: Gas ONE GS-3900P
customer_reviews.text: Great portable burner, only thing I noticed is when trying to put it on low heat it just shut off,. so you really need to watch the flame as you turn the dial down to actually make sure you don't turn it off before getting to the low heat setting Also when using it, use a pan with small handles on each side. A pan with a single handle will cause it to be off balance and fall off until its weighted with food.
customer_reviews.author: Magic City Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: It burns hot. It simmers great. It will accept either butane cartridges or more economical propane. It seems to do pretty well in a breeze. My only complaint is that pans wobble because it seems like a spot weld let go on the inner ring where the supports rest. It heavily coated so I can't see the crack but the support is higher than the other three and pushing down on it produces a crackling sound. It's not real bad, just enough that it's annoying and disappointing to me since I paid extra for this model.
customer_reviews.author: chugger

customer_reviews.title: Hotter than other Butane stoves
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome, I have other Butane portable stoves but this one is hotter than my other ones so cooking is faster, the convenience of Propane is a plus although I mostly use Butane but for keeping warmer the propane is the only way to go butane only last a few hour's on low but propane will last much longer on a small bottle and day's on a big tank. Switching butane or propane is easy and the carrying case is good too overall I'm very happy with my purchase as I do alot of outdoor activities that this is very convenient for.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: This little burner is great. Since I will probably only use propane, the hose assembly was quick and easy. This unit brought two quarts of water to a boil in just under five minutes. Heat adjustment works fine allowing for a simmer. My only complaint is that the carrying case is too small to allow leaving the propane hose attached. Minor detail. The hose is easy to attach/de attach. Nice unit, well built, easy operation. Plenty of heat. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Burn, baby, burn.
customer_reviews.text: Christened this bad boy last night with some Korean BBQ and it worked well! My boyfriend and I actually had to turn it down because we could not keep up with its fire power. Clean up was also a breeze because the black grate part can come all the way off and be washed. The box does seem filmsy and I saw that another reviewer had a broken one. Luckily, mine came intact. Love that it can be converted to a propane tank. We hope to invite others to do KBBQ and hotpot in the future!
customer_reviews.author: *blinkblink*

customer_reviews.title: Great fires first time every time stove.
customer_reviews.text: This little stove is the greatest. Have a smaller butane Stove around the $20. Range and it was ok but took longer to heat water up for coffee. This Gas one stove heats water or food quickly and efficiently. Real easy to load butane cans and easy to set up every time. Makes camping more fun and easier. Definitely worth spending a little more to get this stove!
customer_reviews.author: Houstontrails

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted dual fuel for flexibility so I bought the GS3400 a while ago and it was good. Now I purchased the GS3900 and it’s even better. It has more heat, and a built in wind shield that provides better stability to pots and pans you put on it. If you use a portable stove only a handful of times a year the GS 3400 will suffice but if you cook regularly with one then you’ll prefer the GS3900 extra perks.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, quality portable cook top, with two fuel source options
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stove to replace a previous one. This one is a nice quality build, the movable parts fit nicely into place. It's light, yet feels sturdy enough to last. I really like that this is a dual fuel source model - either the butane canisters or propane mini-tank - gives me flexibility when shopping for fuel. The flame is even, the solid brass burner is large, it's easy to ignite and control the temperature. With high heat output, I was able to get my large soup pot boiling rather quickly. Perfect for camping or emergency use, or - as I use it - a secondary cook top for using on my patio.
customer_reviews.author: Marc W.

customer_reviews.title: Great little unit. I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use both for camping and outdoor home use. A few times a year I make fried chicken for a party. I hate to do it inside in my open kitchen because it’s so messy and the grease gets atomized all over the house. I bought this specifically because of the high BTU output and during my last fried chicken party, it held the oil temperature pretty well for a little unit. I also bought an adapter to use with my full-size pro painting. Worked flawlessly. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: I Order A Lot

customer_reviews.title: The best gas stove out there
customer_reviews.text: Reasons: 1) its 15k BTU, literally the strongest gas stove I can find plus dual ring of fire. Super strong and cooks anything fast. I used this for kbbq and even boiling water, its amazing I swear 2) it comes with a propane adapter I mightve already lost (my fault) but that's handy for camping or if youd rather just use propane over butane. 3) feels very sturdy and solid. Some of these gas stoves feel flimsy and cheap. This is a solid af
customer_reviews.author: SSC

customer_reviews.title: Great stove
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the Seth McGinn's multi-fuel version of this stove and it didn't last for a full 4 days before there was a problem, rendering it unusable with propane. So I returned it and got the Gas ONE GS-3900P New Dual Fuel Propane stove and I'm very happy with it! On my recent 5 day camping trip, it quickly boiled water for coffee every morning and on two mornings, it easily simmered my steel cut oats for 20 minutes. I do have a couple butane canisters, but I primarily use the 1 LB propane bottles which lasted me (cooking twice a day) for the 5 days I was out. All in all, I'm VERY happy with the Gas One
customer_reviews.author: Paul K. Mcclure

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased...
customer_reviews.text: Great little stove. Haven't used the propane yet, but I am liking the butane. 1 can lasted through breakfast, lunch, and dinner. And that includes perculator coffee ! I like that the grate is big enough for my 10" cast iron pan, and by that I mean it sits within the confines of the little "guards" that keep the pan from sliding off the grate. Packs up nice and small. The case is pretty much junk, and I don't expect that to last much past a trip or two. But I'm on the hunt for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: JOE WIKERT

customer_reviews.title: High power output, works great with multiple gas types!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy about the boil time. It took 5.5min to boil 4 cups of water, with a box fan on high 6ft away. It simmers okay, but have to be careful as the flame will snuff out when the dial is below ~10-20% of full power. Using propane works great, and the tanks hold more than butane. You could also connect it to a large refillable tank for extended run times.
customer_reviews.author: Toozinger

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and works well
customer_reviews.text: This stove is ideal for camping or an emergency supply kit. It is compact and lightweight and comes in its own carrying case. It burns clean and the gas knob is smooth to control and unlike my Coleman stove stays in place where you put it. I am able to bring the flame down very low and up to full burn for different cooking needs. The case is a little flimsy but it works. The bottle cover doesn't lock in place like I think it is supposed to but it's not a big problem. Other than these two things I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: Super Hot
customer_reviews.text: Super hot portable stove-top. I'm using it to start Thaan Binchotan charcoal for yakatori grills. Quick start and feels well built. The plastic storage container could use a little more heft. Seems like the latches and/or hinges might not survive frequent use or transport. In my case, it is just a place to store the item as I don't intend to travel with it. The included hose that adapts to more common propane containers is great, but it took quite a bit of fiddling to get the hose attached to the unit due to the small thread size and angle of attachment. Overall, I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry K.

customer_reviews.title: No Accurate Color
customer_reviews.text: Functionality and aesthetics work together. The picture shows a black burner but I got a beige color one. That aside, the flame seems well and even. However, with the propane adapter, the stove is too light and will move because the hose and the small propane tank will push it around. Just be aware of that also. Otherwise, functionality of the burner itself looks really good.
customer_reviews.author: The Unbiased Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Gas One stands and Delivers!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of the GS-3900P single burner stoves. One for use at home and one for my self built stealth/travel van. I am pleased to mention that they arrived undamaged and intact and complete, Hooked em up to propane and they both perform as described. High to low flame control works perfectly on both. Looking forward to many enjoyable uses. I love to cook/prepare simple 1 pan meals. couldn't be happier. Thanks Gas One. Great job.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Temple

customer_reviews.title: Just shoot me get it over
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I have to say again Wow. The plastic case they gave me, I'm better off with a paper bag. The fuel line it is plastic and not flexible and a fighter. The dual fuel regulator for propane is extremely questionable it seems to be a few customers had some real problems with that as well as the fuel line I'm not the only one. The body of the stove is copied and manufactured just like all the others. 40 years of living in political suppression and living as a disabled person homeless in the streets not by choice. I watched the spawn of Satan and capitalism. I have found its cousin
customer_reviews.author: Lone Wolf

customer_reviews.title: VERY nice
customer_reviews.text: I have it hooked via a regulator hose to a 20# tank, and it is going simply rock for cooking campfire breakfasts... I haven't been able to get the output I want to do omelets for the crew out of the "camping" stoves, but this thing is a monster. It has ALL the BTUs you will need...
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Bogie

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor stir frying in the winter
customer_reviews.text: This stove gets hot enough to stir fry outdoors in the winter, and it works well with both butane cartridges and those small propane canisters they sell for camping. The butane cartridge heater is a nice touch that helps them work a little better, especially in the cold, but I normally use propane. My only complaint is that the welds holding the windscreen on are a bit weak, and I accidentally broke one with my thumb.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Still works great. Powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this single burner stove specifically for its high heat output, since I like to stir fry noodles using a 14 inch/7 quart frying pan, which is a little large for the electric range. The burner produces an impressive amount of heat, and has no problem maintaining a high, even temperature throughout that massive pan. The spark igniter works every time, and I also like the removable top for easy cleaning. Been using for several months now with no problems whatsoever. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Bahr

customer_reviews.title: Gas ONE GS-3900P New Dual Fuel Propane or Butane Portable Stove
customer_reviews.text: This stove does not seem to give the 15,000 BTU it claims to do, but I'll keep it because it uses both butane and propane gas. I got the adapter hose to connect to the provided propane hose that comes with the unit so I can use a 5lb tank if I need to. I don't think this stove is worth $60.00 plus tax because of its fire output and the cheaply made plastic case, but ease of use is great.
customer_reviews.author: Yobcibmuag

customer_reviews.title: Use with caution as the tank can fall pulling the grill with it.
customer_reviews.text: I like this cause I use it for camping and didn’t want to bring a large campfire stove top. This works good but it lacks being compact during use. The hose comes out of the unit into a propane tank. I worry that if the tank falls off the table, it will pull everything to the ground. It’s a bit flimsy with the hose and tank.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Sonny Bui

customer_reviews.title: One of the best flame controls I have even seen in the portable ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the best flame controls I have even seen in the portable stoves. I tried before Camp Chef Mountaineer 2 Burner Aluminum Stove and Everest Two Burner Camping Stove. Construction of the Camp Chef Mountaineer series is not comparable to this one at all. This stove is my favorite so far To bad 2 burner one requires 2 separate fuel sources.
customer_reviews.author: Tomasz Klys

customer_reviews.title: Excellent compact stove
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a high BTU grill and the fact this uses propane or butane is an added bonus. This grill really impressed me with how hot it got which was great for what I was cooking. The clean-up was really easy and everything fit (minus the fuel) into a carrying case. The compact size makes it great for storage. Overall if you are looking for a high BTU compact stove then this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Cher Kachelmuss

customer_reviews.title: Adjusts heat well with cast iron
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep in my pickup along with a 10” cast iron pan to cook when I’m out hunting. I have used it twice in fairly windy conditions and it performs flawlessly. I am especially impressed with how you can adjust the heat. Other reviewers have stated that the case is cheaply made and they are absolutely correct. I will not knock it for that though as I knew that going in and I didn’t buy it for the case. It is awesome and I am thoroughly impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect companion for my Coleman stovetop coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to use with our Coleman stovetop coffee maker. It's the perfect size, and it cranks out a ton of BTUs. I noticed that it took me about 24 minutes to make a full pot of coffee, but your first large cup of coffee was ready after about 10 minutes. One potential drawback is that because it is so powerful it will use up one of these butane tanks fairly quickly. After having it burn on high for about 25 minutes, the butane tank feels about half empty. But, it's a hybrid, so if you run out of butane, you can always use propane.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy S.

customer_reviews.title: Boils water fast
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little burner that boils water quickly! I bought it for making coffee on our houseboat and so far so good. It’ll boil the water in the coffee percolator in roughly five minutes. It seems to use the propane wisely and is easy to clean. The case could be built better (it’s pretty flimsy), but it should hold up just fine for storage. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D

customer_reviews.title: Gas lid
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this product. The lid doesn't latch for the gas enclosure. The lid stays closed when cooking because of gravity, but moving around is annoying. Having to move it around and the lid constantly falling open definitely a poor design.
customer_reviews.author: JESSE

customer_reviews.title: If I lost it I would buy the same one again.
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to use this camping, we full time in an RV. This will take the place of my Weber Q for making bacon outside in a cast iron griddle. Takes up less space and is much lighter in weight. I bought this model for the dual fuel option and the quality burner. So far I have added a windscreen and it is working as hoped. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Of The Bunch
customer_reviews.text: Take my word...of all the different brands of this type of stove out there, this one (GS-3900p) is the best. And man, 15,000 BTU's? You better believe it! This baby cooks as hot as you need. Fully adjustable flame so you can cook slow and low too. Easy to use. I can set this sucker up and get'er lit in under a minute. What's not to love.
customer_reviews.author: MickeyMark

customer_reviews.title: Decided to get away from Electric range & "plastic coated" ...
customer_reviews.text: Decided to get away from Electric range & "plastic coated" fry pans ; have used this portable gas stove four times so far as I just got it --- no hot spots , works a steak in my new stainless steel on the smallest of flames perfectly ---
customer_reviews.author: logan

customer_reviews.title: Duel fuel
customer_reviews.text: Specifically bought this since it uses butane or propane for when I want to travel light or lug my propane tank with me for longer trips. This thing puts out some serious heat, I use it on medium/high to heat up my cast iron pan but only use low when cooking, any more heat and the food starts to burn.
customer_reviews.author: T. Danger

customer_reviews.title: Lop-sided
customer_reviews.text: 1 very huge complaint - the stove came lop-sided. The little plate/grate that the pan sits on top of is uneven. The right side sits higher than the left which makes it unsafe to cook on as everything shifts/slips to the left. This also causes uneven heating of the pan which is unfortunate because the heat output is so great! In addition, the grate came chipped on one of the corners. Over all, pretty disappointed as this was a fairly expensive product.
customer_reviews.author: cyndie

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for what we purchased it for
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect for what we purchased it for. My husband makes pezzelle cookies using a special "iron" that his father made a long long time ago. We usually had gas stove before we moved to FL, but our stove here is electric and he just can't control the heat as precisely as he can on gas. He tried the Gas One for the first time yesterday and was very very pleased. Merry Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Cicci

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, except for big chip in the paint on the trivet.
customer_reviews.text: Stove looks great, but there was a big chip in the paint/coating missing on one corner of the trivet. Will re-rate this product after I get this resolved with Gas One/Amazon fulfillment. Will not check out the function of the burner until then.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I tested this against my best portable stove. For years nothing could beat that stove for heat generation and overall durability. This flat-out does. not even close. I was able to boil 3 qts of water in 10 mins in a rather skinny pot. If it were wider, it would have been even faster. Of course at that rate, it eats fuel a bit faster, but not by much. Im very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ringo5000

customer_reviews.title: Great camping stove.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for heating water in the morning for coffee, great for cooking as well. I used this everyday on a 10 day camping trip and it worked great. I used butane and got about 2.5 uses on high heat per canister at sea level. Love the carrying case too. Easy to set up, lights every time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan O

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Portable One Burner Stove
customer_reviews.text: Perfect stove for outdoor cooking. Use Butane or 1 lbs. Propane Tanks. Also comes with case for storage. Case is on the cheap side but does it’s job. Would recommend for camping, fishing, or tail gating. Also would be good for emergency use if you loose power.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Works as stated
customer_reviews.text: I wish there were incremental lines on the heat output "triangle." When one roasts green coffee beans the heat is critical. By not having incremental lines (I know it wasn't designed for this purpose) it makes it harder to consistently obtain the same heat output.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: This Gas One stove’s flame can be managed beautifully from high flame to very low simmer
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly and just as advertised. I purchased this product as an alternative to my Coleman burner which took up a lot of table space and was limited in the control of flame output. This Gas One stove’s flame can be managed beautifully from high flame to very low simmer. I ran it on both butane and propane fuels and the switch from one to the other is seem less. The positive reviews on this product are well justified and I recommend it highly for anyone looking for an efficient camping or outdoor stove.
customer_reviews.author: David Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with Flaking Paint on the Stove Grate
customer_reviews.text: I researched and shopped a lot of these units and through that this was THE ONE. However, when I unpacked the unit, a lot of chipped paint fell out of the box that had flaked off of the stove grate. I tried to resolve with the merchant by swapping out the grate for a new one as it is removable, but I now have to return the whole unit and order another one. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ALL THE BTUS
customer_reviews.text: You can use it with some universal butane canisters or just get yourself a 16 oz propane canister and you'll be fine. Hell I suppose you could probably get a big propane canister and use it as well. Heats very quickly. High btu for a single burner. Cooks stir fry like a pro
customer_reviews.author: Tevin

customer_reviews.title: Great Stove
customer_reviews.text: This stove is versatile and flexible. If hooked up via hose and external bottle, it allows for greater capacity and longer burn times. If you need it to be portable you can hook it up with an internal bottle and it transports easily. The high output BTU's is perfect for for searing and flash cooking.
customer_reviews.author: OZ4

customer_reviews.title: Great for tailgating!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a tailgating expert lol!! But I have a car not an SUV. This is so portable light weight easy fast simple absolutely perfect for tailgating. I use a cast iron skillet and can grill easly last Saturday I did breakfast sausage and eggs over easy then did skirt steak later in the same skillet. When finished right in your trunk without the worry of explosion!!
customer_reviews.author: Marlon j Nasser

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Single Burner Stove Top
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived on time and was packaged well for shipping. I have been using it for about a week now and I'm impressed. It will boil 3 cups of 40 deg water in less than 4 minutes. I made Chicken Cacciatore in a cast iron skillet tonight, outside in 45 deg weather and everything cooked quickly and maybe faster than my gas stove in the house. I have only used the propane so far and have been very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: carrying case.... A+
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like the USPS delivering it to the wrong unit. Fortunately the person that got it was very nice and brought it over to my unit. Other than that the stove perform flawless with both fuel setups. Going to take it camping in a few days.
customer_reviews.author: McCoke

customer_reviews.title: I love the versatility
customer_reviews.text: This is a great compact but full powered gas stove! I cooked a pot of rice, whiting it out over high flame then turning it to a super low simmer to finish the perfectly cooked rice. It's also powerful enough to effectively fire a 14" wok.
customer_reviews.author: Dempsy Winans

customer_reviews.title: Great stove, dangerous leaky regulator
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this stove for use of my discada while camping. The stove works great, is very light weight and portable however potentially dangerous. The stove had maybe an hour of run time on it before the regulator failed. Luckily it failed when not in use, that could've been really bad. Seems to be a common issue and only complaint with the stove. Instead of dealing with manufacture I ordered a new hose, one that goes straight to a larger tank.
customer_reviews.author: Nave

customer_reviews.title: A lot of heat with a low profile.
customer_reviews.text: Big pots and pans are very stable on this unit. If the hose is a little crooked from shipping, let it sit out in the sun for a few hours and straighten it. The one pound propane cylinders stand up and work well with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: I use it daily
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on both fuels and love the flexibility. It is a bit smaller than the butane only so fits perfectly on my countertop and I can leave it out. The case came cracked and is very flimsy so I threw it away. Seems to run a better blue flame on propane. If you are cooking outside make sure to buy the windscreen as well. You will need it.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia L.

customer_reviews.title: Great product and a must have
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my wok to use at home. It is absolutely perfect. Lightweight, comes in a nice case to store in. Ability to use butane or propane was a big selling point. Produces great heat output, durable L, lightweight and stable.
customer_reviews.author: M.B.

customer_reviews.title: Stove is great, case not so much
customer_reviews.text: Received the stove. all components seem to be excellent quality. Haven't taken camping yet. Tested the stove and it burned both type of fuels well (very minimum adjustability with propane). Took one star off for the poor quality of the case. This will be a camping stove, so transporting securely is important. I have no confidence that the case will hold up, I'll probably replace with a generic soft case.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Highly Recommended! Also no need to buy the butane hose adapter in already comes with it. Amazon needs to correct this because Amazon is under the impression that it doesn't come with it therefore they sell it to you.
customer_reviews.author: AXHEJAZ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent burner; good price
customer_reviews.text: Great outdoor burner. Wind shield works very well. Nice case. Sturdy and well built. Puts out a lot of heat. Can hold large pots and pans. Easy to put fuel containers in it. Good price. Basically, an excellent burner to use when grilling, camping or any other outdoor situation. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Phronesis

customer_reviews.title: but it looks great. We did fire it up with propane and ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't gotten to use this burner yet, but it looks great. We did fire it up with propane and it lit right up. We got it to keep in our RV, to cook outside. It sure looks like it has plenty of power. If it works well for us, we'll probably take it hunting as well. We have not tried it with Butane yet. The case seems adequate and will help keep it clean. The whole burner top comes off, so it'll be easy to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A Holiday

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these burners We use them when we camp. I like the fact that it can handle large griddles and it heats very fast. On our last camping trip I used a large cast iron griddle and it worked great with this burner.
customer_reviews.author: GSH

customer_reviews.title: Can use a 14" wok
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little stove. Enough power to cook with a 14" wok. Dual fuel feature will come in handy, as the 8 oz. butane canisters are not always available. Flame control is good, stable. Can be turned down low enough to simmer. Only gave it four stars because the metal for the frame and canister door cover is a bit flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dual fuel is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: This one costs more than a lot of the others, but the higher heat output and dual fuel is worth it. The burner has 2 rings of jets for cooking. Out on the road you have a better chance of finding fuel from the small town stores since it uses butane or propane tanks.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Olenslager

customer_reviews.title: Way better than a Coleman.
customer_reviews.text: Way better than my coleman stove!! You can actually control the heat output!
customer_reviews.author: Ross Garmoe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stove
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for car camping, but it is better than the stove in my kitchen. I run it on propane and it throws more heat than any stove I've ever had. I have used several times and it is well built and holding up to the camping box with no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: John Stricklen

customer_reviews.title: Great stove - high output
customer_reviews.text: It performs very well. We used one of the basic stoves in the $20 category for years and this a vast improvement in performance. Obviously if you double the btu it will also increase the fuel consumption but it is still reasonable. We used both fuels, works both well.
customer_reviews.author: Wen and M

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!  Got an extension/adapter, run it off the LP bottle
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. It's smallish, takes either butane cans or camping-size propane bottles. With a $6 adapter I run it directly off a 25# LP bottle (the one for my grill). It's hot as crap, I cook with it almost on "low". I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Austin David

customer_reviews.title: Works great but regulator is suspect.
customer_reviews.text: Works well but less than 90 days in the propane tank regulator failed leaking propane from the tank. Luckily I was there and heard, smelled and quickly figured out what had happened. The ice on the cylinder was a dead give away to the leak. I’m lucky that there was no open flame nearby. Hopefully I can get a replacement for the regulator. I’d will watch it carefully from now on.
customer_reviews.author: mark t.

customer_reviews.title: My new super stove!
customer_reviews.text: bought this to replace a 2 burner that didn't fit in my newly Tiny camper. It's PERFECT for those who only use one burner at a Time, and Has some HEAT, enough weight, and a sturdy enough structure to feel safe using it. Don't ya hate waiting for the water to boil with lower power stoves? This 15 is PERFECT and works better than some home burners. One of my best choices in travel trailer Lifestyle tools- :)
customer_reviews.author: T.E.O.T.

customer_reviews.title: Good Stove for Camping
customer_reviews.text: I like this stove. I used it during our camping trip at the Eastern Sierra. The heat and flame is very well distributed. It comes with the hose to convert the fuel from butane to propane. I used both fuel, butane and propane, and both resulted to good cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Sonnie

customer_reviews.title: Compact/Portable stove.
customer_reviews.text: Works Great , compact and light weight, bit expensive comparing to other models but the heat it delivers rocks. I used Butane and Propane felt no difference. Worked well even near beach.
customer_reviews.author: Nimmy

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised but...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Bumped a star down because the butane cartridge flap wouldn't close fully. Something must have been bent thus preventing the flap from closing fully, could be just an issue with the unit I got. Returned it as I'm not sure if it is safe to have the butane canister exposed to direct heat without protection from the flap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this portable stove. The max heat output is very high for such a small stove, and it can be easily adjusted to handle simmer. Using an adaptor that I separate bought, I have the stove hooked up to a 20lb propane tank.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Good stove for emergency or camping use.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this purchase. I live in the mountains of Southwest Va where power outages are common place. I bought the stove primarily for this use. I have used it a couple of times just to become familiar with it prior to an emergency situation. It is both easy to set up and to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little stove. Used this for cooking little things in my tent and it works great. Just turn the knob and it starts right up. Puts out a lot of cooking heat and can also be turned down very low. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!Great company
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stove for wok cooking. Outstanding heat output and feels nice and heavy (sturdy) in the hand. I did a lot of research on butane stoves and other than this is a great product. The manufacturer customer service was the best out of all other brands I researched and I researched them all. If u have any questions like i did call gasone and they will take care of any questions.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Have not used but seems simple to use. Quality build.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it accepts butane and propane. Instructions are fairly easy to understand. Have not used yet. Appears to be well made. Amazon delivered on date promised, well packaged, free shipping. Cannot find this product in local stores.
customer_reviews.author: Kamakea

customer_reviews.title: Great little burner for camping compact and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Great little burner used it this past weekend on camping trip and it did it’s job well had water bowling in about 2 minutes and the indentions are a nice touch they keep the pots in place. Used a 15lb tank with adapter so I don’t know how long it would last with the smaller cans. I will say it is a little on the flimsy side and the box is very flimsy so the only reason it’s not getting 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Abhay Delgado

product_meta.title: Gas ONE GS-3900P New Dual Fuel Propane or Butane Portable Stove with Brass Burner Head, Dual Spiral Flame 15,000 BTU Gas Stove with Convenient Carrying Case Most Powerful Heat Output Stove
product_meta.description: Price Zone dba J&S International is a company that specializes in camping and outdoor recreation products under our brand, Gas One. We are a leading manufacturer of portable outdoor cookers, burners, and other general kitchenware products. With UL and CSA certification, we provide high quality and safe products at competitive prices for the U. S. market. We, at Price Zone, strive to create products that are safe, functional, and convenient from the customer s perspective. Price Zone has been in business for 18 years and it has grown into an established company with customers all over the U. S. as well as overseas.
feature_bullets: ✓ 15, 000BTU MOST POWERFUL STOVE IN THE MARKET - Compatible with both butane (Fuel not included) and propane fuel (Fuel not included) / Operates on a single butane cartridge 8 oz or a propane cylinder 16. 4 oz (Propane adaptor hose Included)
✓ PIEZO-ELECTRIC IGNITION - that eliminates the use for lighter/matches in order to ignite flame
✓ EASY TO USE - Our GS-3900P is easy to use with adjustable heat dial and piezo-electric ignition ***Great for Camping, Backpacking and Emergency Preparedness***
✓ SAFETY FEATURES - Built in Pressure Sensor Cartridge Ejection System and Gas Flow Cut Off Mechanism
✓ WINDBLOCKER - With Heavy duty Windblocker 4 corners of the burner head, It eliminates stove from turning off from the wind
✓ CARRYING CASE - Includes Sturdy Carrying Case for easy transport and storage

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
